head.supplied: Melbourne, botanic & zoologic Garden, ¶ 19. ¶ ¶ Aug 1861 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ In submitting to your favorable consideration a schedule of estimate of expenditure for the botanic Garden during the year 1862, I ...

div.p: T61/6743, unit 749, VPRS 1189/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

In submitting to your favorable consideration a schedule of estimate of expenditure for the botanic Garden during the year 1862, I have the honor to point out, that the estimate of the zoological Gardens expenses will be early under the consideration of the Committee of the acclimatisation Society, but that the absence of Edward Wilson Esq., who is at present in New South Wales, is likely to cause a delay of a few days in the preparation of the estimate for the zoological Department.
I have the honor to be,
your most obedient and humble servant
Estimate of Expenditure in the Melbourne botanic Garden during the year 1862

cell.p: " to the Curator

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

cell.p: Wages to Gardeners, Labourers, Artisans, Carters, botanical Collectors, Messenger &c

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: The wages-fund cannot well be diminished, if out of it all the smaller repairs in the establishment have to be defrayed as formerlyandif it is desired, that public institutions should be supplied as extensively as before from this garden with plants and seeds. In thenorthern ground moreover will after the removal of part of the animals still considerable labour be required,for keeping the ground in order and for continueing improvements, such as the formation of walks, drains, avenues; similar new arrangements are also yet necessary in the southern ground.

cell.p: Purchase of plants and seeds

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: This sum is intended for the purchase of seeds for lawns; also for the acquirement of plants and seeds from collectors or nurseries at home and abroad, whenever such are not obtainable by interchange.

cell.style: border-top: none; border-left: none; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: Expenses for publishing works on Australian plants

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: This sum would furnish illustrations in continuance of the publication of Dr Muellers work on Victorian plants, but it is also submitted to the consideration of the Government that a contribution of £100 might be made out of this vote to Mr G. Bentham, F.L.S., London, for whose universal flora of Australia, probably to be brought out under Dr Muellers aid, subsidies have beensolicited by Sir Will. Hooker of Kew from all the Australian Governments.

cell.style: border-top: none; border-left: none; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: Stores, timber, tools, herbarium-material, fencing materials, flower pots, labels &c &c

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border-top: none; border-left: none; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: Forage for two draft horses and such quadrupedes, singing birds, water birds, fishes and other animals, as may be retained at the botanic Garden

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p:
It would not be possible to reduce this sum still further, since many of the animals and structures for their keeping cannot readily be removed and as it would also be a source of regreat
regret?
especially to the residents in the vicinity of the garden,if the garden were entirely deprived of such animals, as are with little expense and care easily kept.

cell.style: border-top: none; border-left: none; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: Transit expenses for plants, seeds &c and incidental expenses

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

cell.p: Travelling expenses

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border-top: none; border-left: none; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p:
Towards the enlargement of the collections in the botanical museum
Marginal annotation by unknown,'not to be included', and by Heales, 18 October 1861: 'altered and approved'. The estimates for 1861, ordered to be printed 11January 1861 contained a sum of £1600 'towards formation of a Botanical Museum' (Parliamentary Paper B 1, Estimates of the expenditure of the Government of Victoria for the year 1861, p.
14).

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border-top: none; border-left: none; border-bottom: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-right: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: By a judicious purchase of prepared extra-Australian plants, for the acquisition of which this sum is solicited, our botanical museumwould be rendered one of the most important of the globe and would furnish material for independent labours in any branch of descriptive Botany for which our botanical Office has already since several years past (as far as means permitted) been of service not only to this but also to the surrounding colonies.

cell.style: border-top: none; border-left: none; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border-top: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-left: none; border-bottom: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-right: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
